text:
You should only need to save the page, not publish it.
Check that your base template contains {{ standard_header_includes }} in the <head></head> of the page.
This is located in /YOUR-THEME-FOLDER/templates/layouts/base.html

I tried that again and when trying to upload the theme it says “mobile is the only valid responsive breakpoint name” and when using it twice “breakpoint names must be unique”.  This seems to also be reflected here in the docs:  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/responsive-breakpoints#define-breakpoints-in-a-theme>
So it is not supported yet and I might try adding a custom columns module. It’s a good idea anyway as I can also add gap size settings and so on.
this is what i thought. worth the try but yeah. good luck
I am not able to locate it, please can you help with locating?
are you using a custom theme or marketplace theme?
Hi everyone can someone remind me how to see all the vertical spans like this thanks.
